> The most normal way to deal with async behaviour in REST is to create
> a resource (POST to some place) and then poll it for it's state
> change.

Okay, let's run with this.  POST to the server, creating a "command"
resource.  It's parameterized to indicate PowerOn targeting the resource
corresponding to the Device to which power will be applied.  The command
transitions from "Incomplete" to "Complete" over the course of its
execution.

This approach nicely separates the device status/state from the command
state, but I was under the impression that such an approach was too
borderline RPC to be considered RESTful.
